args: What's up, Su Fang? You don't look happy.
Did today's pyroblossoms kinda suck\nor something? Are you feeling like\na bitter artist right now?
That's not a very nice thing to ask him,\nNotte. Someone as skilled as Su Fang\nwould never—
Sure he would! If anything, his skill's\nlikely to make him even MORE picky.
Pros sweat the details and all that, yeah?
Worry not—my work is up to its\nusual high standard.
Then why did you look so serious?
Seeing those two reminded me of that boy\nwe met a while back.
The one who lost his parents?
I feel as though I was able to cheer him\na little with my pyroblossoms.
I can't help but wonder how he's doing.
Well, why don't we go check in on him?
...Ah! Is that who I think it is?!
I didn't know you'd taken on a student!
Then I get to be your first!
But don't worry—I'll make sure your skills\nare passed down through me.
I'm not teaching you my skills!
Pyroblossoms are very dangerous if\nhandled incorrectly—I can't just start\nteaching people the art willy-nilly!
If they were to get into the hands of\nsomeone with evil intent...
I'd NEVER do that! How dare you!
Easy, now. Let's not make assumptions.
So you want Su Fang to take you under\nhis wing and teach you how to be a\npyroblossom artisan, right?
That's right. And I know it'll be hard or\nwhatever, but like I told you earlier,\nI'm totally ready for that.
I don't recall you telling me\nanything of the sort.
Please take me on as your student!\nI wanna use pyroblossoms to give\nothers the strength to live on!
The display you showed really\nmoved me, you know?
It made me feel like I could keep going.
I want to be able to do that for other\npeople in the same position.
Sounds like his heart's in the right place\nto me, Su Fang. What do you think?
The happiness of those who watch\npyroblossoms is what should matter\nmost to an artisan.
It took me a long time to realize that,\nbut he knows it right from the start.
I know what you're worried about,\nbut I think he'll be just fine.
I accept you as my student.
Yesss! I did it! Thanks, Master!
I wouldn't be getting excited just yet.\nThere is much work ahead of you.
That's great! ...Er, so what do I do now?
Then that's what I'm gonna do!\n...Wait, NOTHING?
Your training begins with your mindset.
Until I'm convinced you've fulfilled that\ncondition, I'm not letting you touch\na single pyroblossom.
I'm gonna get the mindset you want\nbefore you know it!
Su Fang and Kelvin became master and student—\nand to celebrate the occasion, Su Fang delivered\na fantastic pyroblossom display.
Wow! I didn't know they could change\ncolors like this! How does it work?!
You have quite the passionate student.
Do you really think I'm up to being his\nmaster, {player_name}?

I may have sounded clever when I spoke
of starting training with a mindset,
but I was just repeating the words
my master once told me.
I don't think there's anything\nwrong with that.
That's just how teaching works—\nyou learn something and pass it down.
Now you need to pass your knowledge\nto your own student.
Thank you. I think I finally understand\nmy role now.
I shall pass down the spirit and desires\nof those who walked before me to the\nnext generation of artisans.
Soon, my student and I will fill\nthe night sky with wonder!
